Expectation1: Provide guidance and wisdom based on life experience
Situation1: A grandchild directly asks their grandfather for help and advice with a serious concern in their life.
Expectation2: Review and analyze legal documents and contracts
Situation2: A purchase agreement needs analysis before an upcoming filing deadline that is drawing nearer.
Story: I sat at my desk, legal documents spread before me, the clock ticking louder with every passing minute. The purchase agreement needed my full attention—every clause, every word, had to be scrutinized before the filing deadline. My client was counting on me to catch any oversight, and I knew the consequences of a mistake could be severe. Just as I reached for my pen, my phone buzzed. It was my grandson, his voice trembling as he asked if he could come over. He needed advice, he said—something serious was weighing on him, and he trusted me to help him make sense of it. I could hear the hope in his voice, the expectation that I would offer the wisdom and comfort only a grandfather could provide. My heart ached, torn between the duty to my client and the love for my grandson. The documents on my desk seemed to blur as I wrestled with the impossible choice, feeling the weight of both roles pressing down on me.
